item.name: Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs Committee

item.title: Ensuring Military Access to Higher Education Benefits Act of 2024

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Armed Services, and in addition to the Committee on Education and the Workforce, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

item.name: Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs Committee

item.text: Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs. Hearings held.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

item.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

cdata.text:
Ensuring Military Access to Higher Education Benefits Act of 2023

This bill requires the Department of Defense to complete a data matching agreement with the Department of Education to ensure that current or former active-duty military service members or civilian employees who are eligible for the public service loan forgiveness program have their periods of employment (beginning on October 1, 2007) automatically certified and counted towards the program.

bill.title: Ensuring Military Access to Higher Education Benefits Act of 2023

item.title: Ensuring Military Access to Higher Education Benefits Act of 2023

A bill to require the Secretary of Defense to complete a data matching agreement with the Secretary of Education in order to ensure individuals who are current or former active-duty military service members or civilian employees and are otherwise eligible for assistance under the public service loan forgiveness program have their periods of employment automatically certified and counted towards the public service loan forgiveness program.
Ensuring Military Access to Higher Education Benefits Act of 2023

latestAction.text: Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs. Hearings held.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
